intro: Gratiola bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá grass-vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in moist, high-altitude environments, such as grasslands and forest edges. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pale green or yellowish in color. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of Andean flora and ecological adaptations.
